titleStmt.title: Some further remarks upon Mr. Gadbury's defence of Scorpio by way of addition, to a just reward for unreasonable service. Wherein not only Mr. Gadbury's pretentions to astrology are dissipated; but even his title to learning and right reason (which by virtue of his horoscope he challenges) is shaken. By the Man in the Moon.
titleStmt.author: Lilly, William, 1602-1681.

notesStmt.note: Man in the Moon = William Lilly. Attribution from Wing.
